revised_title: Rate of Helium Production in Thorianite and Pitchblende: Implications for Geological Antiquity
tldr: The author conducted experiments to measure the rate at which helium is produced in thorianite and pitchblende minerals. By analyzing the amount of helium generated over time, the author aimed to estimate the antiquity of these minerals and validate the method of calculating geological time based on radioactive properties. The results provide insights into the rate of radioactive decay and the formation of helium in minerals, contributing to the understanding of Earth's geological history.
